comments.creator: jduell.mcbugs@gmail.com
comments.author: jduell.mcbugs@gmail.com
comments.text:
I notice chromium has a websockets test (alert-in-event-handler.html) that makes sure the websocket is "suspended" while alert dialogs are happening (rather than continuing to dispatch WS events).  From my initial port of the test it looks like we don't handle the case the way correctly (well, of at least the way they do).

This is perhaps related to bug 668948.

I'm not clear on whether this should block unprefixing.
comments.raw_text:
I notice chromium has a websockets test (alert-in-event-handler.html) that makes sure the websocket is "suspended" while alert dialogs are happening (rather than continuing to dispatch WS events).  From my initial port of the test it looks like we don't handle the case the way correctly (well, of at least the way they do).

This is perhaps related to bug 668948.

I'm not clear on whether this should block unprefixing.

comments.text:
We have different setup for alert, especially in non-e10s. We must spin event loop while it is shown.
And yes, this is very much related to bug 668948. Sync XHR does similarly spin event loop.
comments.raw_text:
We have different setup for alert, especially in non-e10s. We must spin event loop while it is shown.
And yes, this is very much related to bug 668948. Sync XHR does similarly spin event loop.

comments.raw_text: So we need to add a suspect/resume to websockets?  Sounds like it.
